javadoc: Database adapter for managing built-in data types.

methods.name: getAdapter
methods.comment:
Gets an adapter for working with the built-in data type database table. The adapter is based 
 on the version of the database associated with the specified database handle and the openMode.

params.name: handle
params.comment: handle to the database to be accessed.

params.name: openMode
params.comment: the mode this adapter is to be opened for (CREATE, UPDATE, READ_ONLY, UPGRADE).

params.name: monitor
params.comment: the monitor to use for displaying status or for canceling.

throws.comment: if the database handle's version doesn't match the expected version.
if there was a problem accessing the database

return.comment: the adapter for accessing the table of built-in data types.

methods.name: createRecord
methods.comment: Create a new built in types record.

throws.comment: if there was a problem accessing the database

methods.name: getRecord
methods.comment: Gets the Built-in data type record with the indicated ID.

throws.comment: if there was a problem accessing the database

return.comment: the record for the Built-in data type.

methods.name: getRecordIdsInCategory
methods.comment: Returns an array containing the data type IDs for the given category ID

throws.comment: if there was a problem accessing the database

return.comment:
an array of the data type IDs; 
 empty array if no built-in data types.

methods.name: updateRecord
methods.comment: Update the built-ins table with the given record.

throws.comment: if there was a problem accessing the database

methods.name: removeRecord
methods.comment: Remove the record with the given dataID.

throws.comment: if there was a problem accessing the database

methods.javadoc: Returns an iterator over all records for built-in data types.
methods.name: getRecords
methods.comment: Returns an iterator over all records for built-in data types.

name: BuiltinDBAdapter
comment: Database adapter for managing built-in data types.
